capabilities.name: Work Collaboratively
capabilities.description: The role requires forming professional relationships with Aboriginal Owners, various commonwealth and state agencies, and stakeholders, indicating a need for effective collaboration.

capabilities.name: Communicate Effectively
capabilities.description: Strong communication skills are essential for visitor and stakeholder liaison, as well as for supporting the community and managing reserve priorities.

capabilities.name: Plan and Prioritise
capabilities.description: Rangers must balance outdoor duties with indoor work like project management, requiring effective planning and prioritisation.

capabilities.name: Think and Solve Problems
capabilities.description: The role demands strong decision-making and the ability to think on one's feet to tackle evolving reserve management priorities.

capabilities.name: Value Diversity
capabilities.description: Supporting Aboriginal Owners to protect cultural heritage and promoting a diverse and inclusive culture are key aspects of the role.

capabilities.name: Demonstrate Accountability
capabilities.description: Rangers are responsible for undertaking, coordinating, and supervising various projects and activities, requiring a high level of accountability.

capabilities.name: Manage Self
capabilities.description: The role requires personal fitness, enthusiasm, and a proactive approach to learning and development.

capabilities.name: Project Management
capabilities.description: Managing projects and providing administrative support to the Board of Management for Jointly Managed reserves are critical functions.

skills.name: Natural Land Management
skills.description: Applying knowledge of natural land management strategies to protect and maintain natural places.

skills.name: Stakeholder Engagement
skills.description: Engaging with Aboriginal Owners, government agencies, and the community to manage reserves effectively.

skills.name: Firefighting and Incident Control
skills.description: Undertaking firefighting and incident control duties, requiring specific certifications and physical fitness.

generalRole.title: Environmental Field Officer
generalRole.description: This role involves a combination of field-based activities, environmental management, and stakeholder engagement, primarily focused on the conservation and protection of natural environments and cultural heritage.
